msgSnippet: ... Maybe something like: class AllTests { private static RMIServer server = null; public static getRMIServer() { if (server == null) { // initialize } return
messageBody:
> Does anyone know what could I possibly do? Maybe another approach?

Maybe something like:

class AllTests {

private static RMIServer server = null;

public static getRMIServer() {
if (server == null) {
// initialize
}
return server;
}
}

and in the tests, you invoke AllTestrs.getRMIServer().

I've not tested the code but it should work.

If you're not afraid to work with beta code, there's the JUnit-addons
Runner (sf.net/projects/junit-addons). You can define resources to be
initialized before the tests are executed (like a RMI connection). The
code in cvs features an example with an RMI server.
